title: Lineale (proche DIN) savez-vous à quelle typo correspond ce mot ?
author: kouklamov

comments.content:
Perhaps: Google font. Thomas Junold, Actor. [http://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Actor](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725042820/http:/www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Actor)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725042820im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fair1_3494.jpg)

No exact match. Might be proprietary design.  
Not many earmarks in your sample. But note the vertical terminals on \_C\_, the high waist \_R\_ with a straight leg that extends further than the bowl, and the center stroke on the \_E\_ that is shorter than the top and bottom strokes.  
Almost identical:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725042820im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ITCJohnstonInUseWidth90pct_4472.jpg)
  
This is ITC Johnston Medium compressed to 90%.  
And this is the original:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725042820im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ITCJohnstonInUse_6226.jpg)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/johnston/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725042820/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/johnston/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/johnston/")  
Don

In support of my thought that it is a custom design, see an ad with the package logo

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725042820im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FairlucentPackage_3574.JPG)
  
Don
